review: Terrible service - you wait about 5-10 minutes for a server to stop by, then you wait 5-10 minutes for drinks - non alcoholic. If you order alcohol you're waiting longer. Everyone else gets their NA bevs and you're still waiting. Not even a water.  You'd better order right away - otherwise the server won't come back for 10 minutes for your order. So far, 20 minutes minimum and you have drinks but are yet to place your order.  Then the staff usually messes it up when it does come out - usually 20-30 minutes after you order. Then you wait 10 minutes for them to fix it or bring what is missing.  So far I've written this review waiting in the booth for the server to come back for the dessert order we said we would be making in just a couple minutes. It's been 10.  Total incompetence - I'm blaming management - I've only seen a manager once and they were screwing around near the bar. Can't blame an employee that hasn't been trained.  We still come back so I guess my frustration is my own fault - but the food is usually pretty tasty and the molten cake is the best hands down - when it comes out right.  Servers seem busy and overwhelmed constantly - but have 3-4 tables. Ridiculous.  Only 2 servers we have had are any good - competent and quick.  So far - been here over an hour and still waiting on dessert. If you come here you'd better not be in a hurry to be anywhere afterward. Sooooo slow. Its a good thing they have Happy Hour - this place drives you to drink.

Tasty queso. However, a design flaw rendered the chips susceptible to structural failure when used for dipping, leaving chip debris in the queso sauce and exposing the customer to potential finger contamination.

Not so much about chilies , but sitting at bar near chilies , listening to a bartender and server from there , I heard so many bad things . I.e ... Those Jewey bastards that we work for , " I love when wade messes up drinks so I can drink at work"  what a joke , not to mention all the black jokes , it's nice to see racism is alive and well in Ocala fl !! What the hell

Poor service. I sat at the bar, because I was alone and only passing through this area. Big mouth bites were over cooked. What really turned me off was the assumption that I wanted another beer when I specifically asked for the smallest draft available.

Many previous reviews were right- the service here is terrible. We sat there several times during our meal waiting on items while the waiter was literally sitting in the booth directly behind us chilling with his friends who came in for food.  Like, really dude? How rude and unprofessional!  As for the food, it was even worse. After driving over 18 hours from DC, we just wanted something fresh. We ordered two chicken salads and my friend ended up getting sick, which resulted in us having to pull over and delayed our trip even longer than anticipated.  Thanks a lot Chili's. You managed to suck in every way possible.

The service was friendly, but the service was slow. The food was at best ok and that's being nice actually.  I would not eat here again.  I enjoy our local Chili's, but this one was less than impressive. None of the four in our party finished their food after a long wait to get it.

Since moving out of California I am abandoning Chilis as my favorite go to place.  I have eaten at four different Chilis across the southeast and not a single one has measured up to my expectations.  First off, this place has a funky odor that hits you as soon as you enter the door.  The floors look as if they need a good scrub and wax.  I ordered my usual, the spicy shrimp tacos and presidente margaritas.  As soon as the tacos arrived I noticed they look different, almost like fake rubber food.  One bite into it and my mouth is on fire!  By the time I was finished my entire body felt as if it was on fire  I couldn't even enjoy my meal due to the level of spice.  The margarita did not, at all, taste like a presidente I have ever had.

I went to this location about a month ago, wrote a review, and lost it. My experience has haunted me so much though, that I still feel the need to write a review. So here goes:  First off, I don't expect much from chain restaurants, and the night I went I was expecting mediocre food, service, and atmosphere. My expectations were far too high. When we walked into the place, we were greeted by our hostess and the wafting odor of mildew and grease. All of the televisions had been taken off the wall, and the place looked like it was going out of business. The stench in the restaurant cost us our appetite and instead of ordering meals, we just ordered the Texas cheese fries (my FAVORITE Chili's menu item). When it was brought out to us, the plate was covered in cheese and not ONE fry could be seen. We started poking through the cheese and were able to salvage a few poor, suffocating spuds. I never in my life thought I would complain about cheese, but that plate was inedible. Before we left, I stopped in the restroom, and on my way passed by the kitchen. It was clear at this point where at least part of the smell in the restaurant was coming from for there was food literally floor to ceiling in the kitchen. Everything was covered in grease and food, and it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in WEEKS. Ugh. Needless to say, we both felt ill on our long ride home.  NEVER AGAIN. STEER CLEAR.

It's a chain restaurant, so much of the decor, atmosphere, layout, menu etc.. is pretty standard across the board. This is one of the older locations so it still has hints of the old-style Chili's (in-fact this was the first one I went to about 2 decades ago and it still feels that way). We stopped in for a late lunch so the place was pretty empty. We sat in the bar area and were served right away. The waitress kept coming around to check on us so the service was pretty good. The only real drawback was that the place definitely felt out-dated and was trying to be updated, but not going all the way. Otherwise, no real complaints.

I love me some Chili's! I was so excited to see this one off the interstate in Ocala. Was greeted at the door for lunch by a very pleasant young man. I told him I was going to sit at the bar and he said that "Sherri would be right out!" Yay. Another friendly server said the same as I was sitting down. Sherri is awesome! She's super friendly and works very fast and efficiently. I ordered my drinks and food together as I usually do because I'm always afraid the server will run away and not come back for a while. Not Sherri, she was prompt and continued to check on me the entire time. The entire waitstaff was smiling. The management here must be great. The staff is SO friendly. I ordered the mango chili chicken with double broccoli and no rice from the lighter choices menu. As well as a vodka and soda (it was Friday!). Chili's does 2-4-1 happy all day, another great reason I love this place. Sitting at the bar, you can hear everything that goes on in the kitchen. Apparently they time the food. I overheard a few dishes "going on 17 minutes". But I also heard "I need a runner to table (insert number here) please!" Very efficient and systematic operation here, as well as respectful. I've actually never heard the word "please" so many times in the limited amount of time I was there. I could see Sherri getting a little stressed as the to go ordered started to pile in, but she was always calm and collected. As a former server, this isn't easy to do. Situations like being in the weeds can cause meltdowns. The staff was very quick and on their toes here though. My food came out in about 20 minutes. The chicken was a little over cooked but the flavor was great! The broccoli was steamed and fell apart as my fork touched it, perfect. All in all a good meal. It continued to pick up and this place got REALLY busy. I can see why they are so popular. It does feel a little frazzled here though. It's hectic at lunch, the phone doesn't stop ringing and there are a lot of people picking up to go orders. I saw the manager personally apologize to those waiting on to go orders. A lot of them wanted to split checks, which is super annoying as a server, but Sherri was great about it. She's a great multi tasker! I'll be back here as I travel through often. It's exactly how a lunch crowd should be managed. Great staff!!

This is the second time I have been and this is the second time I've left mad. If I could rate as a 0 I would.  No amount of free food would cause me to come back. The restrooms were nasty, toilets overflowing.  Kitchen view looked horrendous!  Never Coming Back!

Take out ordered via Internet, as I was staying at a nearby hotel. Pick up was at the bar, bartender assisted several patron( who arrived after me!) and filled the orders from the waitstaff before bothering with my take out order. Or payment.  My food was correct, but totally cold!  Unacceptable.  I will never go back.

The food was consistently good and that's the reason we come. But the service. .. ouch. You feel like you are in a factory production line. No warmth. No smiles. Thank God for the kiosk so we can eat and run without having to deal with the (lack of) customer engagement.  By the way, not a single "so long and thank you" when you leave. Maybe explains the average 2 stars.

Bad service , the manager was horrible would not even honor as a courtesy a happy hour drink that all other chilis have, he won't last , the customer should come first !! Won't go back , there are other chilis around that have  better service and  you will get waited on !! And have better management

Went  back again after super bad and Slow service  about a month ago..last time we were told our food took so long because they accidentally dropped our veggie burger this time the manager came out to tell us our food was taking so long  because the kitchen accidentally dropped my turkey burger.   Service is always slow...attentiveness to customers is hit or miss   same is true for the SW. Location  and I  experienced the same thing in Orlando

This restaurant is very understaffed. Took a party of 3 15 minutes to get acknowledged. The hostess said one second and continued to do many other jobs until we were seated. There was many empty booths but with old food/drinks on them in the bar area that could've been convenient, if they were cleared. Food is always good, only reason we'd come back.

Worst service at a chili's ever. Sat at the bar, was not offered chips as per tradition, counter was dirty. Bartender was not on top of things. Food was cold. Bartender forgot to put in order for the lady sitting next to me. I could go on about 5 other issues I noticed but you get the point. This place needs new management.

We had good time from 1st step in to last out . We get table right when when we get in . Waitress friendly and fast . We get our drinks in less then two mins . I hope they werent from other table :) . Joke . Hostess changed channel for me on Hockey and really nice time . We ordered food and i want want say 12 mins and we hade plate infront nose . Again i hope wasnt left over from others :)) . Joke . Food good , warm tasty , delicious  .. I Think this chilli's is one of the better ones .

Disgusting food and terrible service every time! I go back in the hopes that maybe it was just an unlucky night but thats never the case. Unclean and full of staff members who do not know anything about customer service or decent edible food. Do not waste your time or money here it's just a huge disappointment!
Giving 1 star because I can't give lower. Disgusting. Filthy. If I had gone to the ladies room prior to eating I would have run for my life.

It's chilis.. just about the same I've come to expect of them. We sat in the bar area for lunch, assuming the service would be faster, plus my grandfather knew they have free chips in that area...  Sure thing, we sit down and get a nice basket of chips and salsa. Yum.  Some of the chips were overdressed like the oil was just under where it should be in heat.  I love their thin chips though. My grandfather ordered a corn on the cob and a salad, both of which he said were good.   I had a salad for an appetizer and then shared the fajitas with my mom.  The salad was good except that I found a couple of foreign objects in it.. 1 bean, and 1 i-have-no-idea-blackened-fried-smthn.. The fajitas were delicious, hard to mess those up. At time to pay the bill, the waitress came over to show us how to do the payment on the computer screen.  She must have thought we were idiots.. because when the transaction was complete, it asks you to do a quick rating/survey.. and she quickly snatched the machine from my mom's hands and stood there filling it out herself.  So rude.. I'm sure she gave herself a lovely review.   I hope management knows those reviews aren't being completed by the customers..

My husband got a gift card for chilies on his birthday. My husband got a cheese burger with fried onions and I got sour cream chicken enchilada, and beef enchillada with rice and beans. His burger and onion rings had zero seasoning on them. They were so bland. My beef tasted like dog food. Very, very dry and burnt. The chicken was so dry it was inedible. The only good thing on my plate was the rice and beans. The staff was very kind and understanding. The waitress took my plate away and gave me a tortilla soup. The only reason I would ever come back would be if we had another gift card. Even then I might just give the gift card away lol

Upon arrival at Chili's we were greeted by a hostess who has clearly seen better days. She did not offer a greeting, instead she dry said "two" grabed menus and started walking. The restaurant was empty yet we were taken to a crowded corner and seated at a small table sandwiched in the corner. A few minutes later our waiter, Ryan, arrived and asked for drink orders. This was quick, and painless as we knew what we wanted to drink. That was the end of quick and painless for the duration of the night. It took seven minutes for the water to be dropped on the corner of the table with a "here". The vodka and tonic that was ordered took another five minutes after the water to be delivered. Mind you there were less than 10 people in the whole place. We decided that we simply wanted appetizers as we had other plans for the night, and we figured it couldn't take that long for appetizers.  We couldn't have been more wrong. The food did not come to the table until 10:56p, which was about 4 minutes before the restaurant was supposed to close. The chicken crispers, which were part of the appetizers tasted like old oil that had previously had cheap store brand fish sticks fried in it. Similarly, the southwest egg rolls tasted like they had just come out from under a heat light where they'd been sitting for most of the night.  By this point the waiter was hovering in hopes of rushing us along, and even asked at one point if we needed boxes.  When asked for sauce to go he came back with empty sace cups so we could take what was left of our sauce. His excuse for this was that the sauce was put up and he "couldn't get us any if he wanted to".  After paying, we left a cash tip on the table, but he came back acting shocked to see that there was no tip on the credit card. The fact of the matter is that the food and service did not justify a tip and he is lucky anything was left. In the end, Chili's has gone downhill and is no longer worth the money nor the wait.

I had lunch here today with a childhood friend.  I was disappointed with the quality of the food.  I ordered the original chicken crispers (very heavily breaded and over cooked), French fries (more like French fry crumbs since there were all tiny fries), corn on the cob (which was warm, NOT hot) and strawberry lemonade.  I'm not sure what the problem was, but there was a problem.  I'm not sure that I will come back any time soon, but I do like the chain.  I'm on holiday, so this was supposed to be a treat for us both.  :(

I had the "signature" chilis ribs. I ordered the half rack with fries. The price was good. The ribs however, were HORRIBLE. I thought that chilis was supposed to be one of the top contenders for ribs, but sadly I was let down. The only good thing that came out of this was the fries. The fries were literally the only good thing i had that was remotely decent.

Slow service, soggy chips, cold french fries, and the wrong burger.  The above is my review, however the app would not let me post just that because it was too short. So I am putting all this in here to make it longer. But this was one of the worst experiences I've ever had at Chili's, a place which I normally quite like

Terrible terrible slow service. Mediocre food. Everything so salty. Waited 25 minutes for appetizer, 45 minutes for entree, food was cold & soggy. It was during lunch, restaurant was kind of busy but not slammed. Server was unapologetic & unattentive.
Our order came out separate the fries were cold the sandwich was warm absolutely horrible

Honestly, after reading these reviews, how is this place still open? I regret not reading these reviews before we went tonight, because they were all spot on. I'm visiting my mom in Ocala this weekend & we went to chilis for dinner & WOW I would have rather chewed on my right hand than gone here. We were sat immediately, but then had to wait 15 minutes to be served. THEN when we finally were greeted, it took AGES to get our drinks & appetizers. When we ordered our entrees, everything came out wrong!! Everything!! How in the world do you misunderstand EVERYONE'S order?? The waitress acted as if it was OUR fault...that she misunderstood everything we said?? I don't know how that works but apparently that's how it works here.  Overall, I'm super thankful I live in Georgia so I'll never have to experience this awful, sorry excuse for a restaurant ever, EVER again.
The food was absolutely disgusting..... Service was good....I will be sure to not stop at the location again....My previous experience with Chili's has been fair.....This one was definitely poor

A while ago, my mother, brother, and  I decide to drop by for some lunch. As an appetizer, we order some chips n salsa. To my opinion & not sure to them, but the chips were cold and salty. I didn't know, you salt nacho chips for the chips n salsa. 910 calories? Are you serious? Never mind...moving on. While that appetizer wasn't the best, our entrées (speaking from all of us) that we really loved them. One of my family members definitely loved the margarita chicken dish. Right enough calories & enough food. Overall, my previous experience with Chili's has been good, but this one was not the same.

This place is a joke. Anytime I ever sit at the bar, the bartender, and it don't matter who it is, always seems overwhelmed, stressed out. There's no friendly banter ever, that makes me feel welcome to drink or eat here. With so many other choices in this area to drink and eat, I'll just go somewhere else.

I wish I would have heed warning from the previous reviews.  Upon our arrival we were offered to be seated in the bar that way wr didn't have to wait for a table. It didn't seem very busy but we opt to sit in the bar area anyways.. Terrible mistake! They had a gentleman one maning service in the entire area. The most painful part of this experience was placing our order and being assured that it would be out momentarily and then watching people who arrived almost a half-hour after us received the very same food items that we had ordered, before we even received our meals. Sitting there, inhaling the aroma and salivating was extremely frustrating. When his manager was requested the gentleman came out stumbling around with apologies and the worst part is he could have been out there helping his server ensure quality service. I don't recommend this place. I do recommend that you continue to drive to somewhere else or simply step next door to El Toreo for authentic Mexican, we did.

It's a shame how much this chain has gone down hill. Service is still good, but the food has gotten awful. Food comes out cold or not cooked all the way through. We sent our food back and the manager didn't even come out to apologize.
Beyond aweful...the table was greasy...the tortilla soup had stale strips....the salmon was burnt n dry, the rice undercooked n crunchy, the broccoli over cooked. Terrible!

Okay, I like Chilis, we eat at our local one on a fairly regular basis.  Some visits the service is a little dicey but the food is normally exactly what you want.  So, when I saw the other negative reviews I just shrugged my shoulders, bad service does happen.  And we did have pretty mediocre service.  But we were a large party of 6 adults and 4 kids, I know, we're no picnic to deal with.  The service was slow, the refills were slow, the waitress was rarely seen.  There was MOLD on the bun of my sister's chicken sandwich.   Mold.  Seriously, how can a place that sells so many burgers even have buns around long enough to get mold?!   Because we were so rarely visited by our waitress, my BIL eventually took my sister's plate up to the Hostess station to get someone to address the problem.   The manager did come and apologize.  And a good portion of our bill was comped.  But seriously, there is Ruby Tuesdays one block further, go there instead.

The 1.5 star rating is generous. Unfortunately I didn't look at yelp prior to coming in. Got a simple salad with shrimp...they were raw. Sent it back. The second try was okay. The bar tender is nice but the place is generally unclean. Won't be back without significant indication of change. This is truly a manager issue. I'd start with a new one if I owned it.

DO EAT HERE. One of the worst Chili's I've ever been to. Floor is disgusting. Floor in the kitchen is even worse. Tiny portions. Burger was over cooked and they served tiny bay shrimp with the shrimp fajitas. Serves was pleasant but barely available. Zero chance we'll be back on our next trip through.

Alot of stuff is taken off the menu just to save their money, kinda selfish, not only that it's noisy,not civilized, and not sanitary or clean, dirty tables, dirty bathrooms, and dirty floors, it's like chili's never heard of janitors 2 star at best

Wish I could write a review without giving it a star, this place is a ZERO!  Don't waste your time, money or sanity! Service is a joke! Management (Stephen) the worst I've encountered.   Corporate wake up and do something! Save your chain name and retrain this location or SHUT it DOWN!  We were not apologized too for having to move tables due to a large loud obnoxious group ( 2 other tables requested to also move), manager not helpful, then food was thrown down at us, no one checked on us after food delivered, couldn't get refills on our drinks or chips then I literally had to run down the manager to pay my bill what a joke!   This restaurant is DIRTY as soon as I saw the back kitchen when using the restroom which was also horribly dirty I should've left, (wish I would've taken photos) dumb dumb me!  I will be calling corporate!  Stay away!
